1808.verse: وَقَالُواْ|And they say,|113|125|760$يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا|"O you|67|90|985$ٱلَّذِى|(to) whom|89|112|138$نُزِّلَ|has been sent down|154|177|5558$عَلَيْهِ|[on him]|75|98|395$ٱلذِّكْرُ|the Reminder,|111|123|9712$إِنَّكَ|indeed, you|97|324|340$لَمَجْنُونٌ|(are) surely mad.|134|361|9713$

1812.verse: وَلَقَدْ|And certainly|107|141|640$أَرْسَلْنَا|We (had) sent|116|183|1342$مِن قَبْلِكَ|before you|102|169|47$فِى|in|48|115|89$شِيَعِ|the sects|83|117|9718$ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ|(of) the former (people).|184|184|5507$

1803.verse: Alif, Lam, Ra. These are the verses of the Book and a clear Qur'an.

1804.verse: Perhaps those who disbelieve will wish that they had been Muslims.

1805.verse: Let them eat and enjoy themselves and be diverted by [false] hope, for they are going to know.

1806.verse: And We did not destroy any city but that for it was a known decree.

1807.verse: No nation will precede its term, nor will they remain thereafter.

1808.verse: And they say, "O you upon whom the message has been sent down, indeed you are mad.

1809.verse: Why do you not bring us the angels, if you should be among the truthful?"

1810.verse: We do not send down the angels except with truth; and the disbelievers would not then be reprieved.

1811.verse: Indeed, it is We who sent down the Qur'an and indeed, We will be its guardian.

1812.verse: And We had certainly sent [messengers] before you, [O Muhammad], among the sects of the former peoples.

1813.verse: And no messenger would come to them except that they ridiculed him.

1814.verse: Thus do We insert denial into the hearts of the criminals.

1815.verse: They will not believe in it, while there has already occurred the precedent of the former peoples.

1816.verse: And [even] if We opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continued therein to ascend,

1817.verse: They would say, "Our eyes have only been dazzled. Rather, we are a people affected by magic."
